title: Looking for a really fat serif w/ extremely thick stems and extremely thin serifs/bars
content:
Looking for a really fat serif with extremely thick stems and extremely thin serifs/bars. Something along the line of Didot in terms of contrast, but with thicker stems then even Heavy Bodoni.

Anyone know any type foundries that would have a font like this?
author: mnkyben

comments.content:
[http://www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022759/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/")

There's a high contrast section in there.

- Lex
[Ambroise Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022759/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/porchez/ambroise_black/): I don't know if it is fatter, but it has more character.
Big Figgins from Carter and Cone

Thanks guys.  
But not quite what im looking for. I might have to custom make it. I just wanted an obscenely fat serif with a hairline stress. Nothing that could be used for body copy at all.

Perla

[http://www.t26.com/fonts/Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022759/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Perla "http://www.t26.com/fonts/Perla")

thin but may be not fat enough

The contrast in [Joshua Darden](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022759/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Joshua%20Darden)'s [Freight Big Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022759/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/garagefonts/freight_big_package/) has a 1:100 ratio. I doubt it gets any more extreme than that. :^)
